intro: Phyllanthus calciphilus, commonly known as the limestone phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the rainy season. The plant thrives in calcareous soils, showcasing its adaptation to limestone-rich environments. Its leaves are usually small and succulent, aiding in water conservation. Phyllanthus calciphilus plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
